Sequence Information.Peptide Name: QS-CATH (Q. spinosa cathelicidin; 1S=S, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: spleen (induced highest), the Chinese spiny frogs,Quasipaa spinosa, Asia

Literature.Author: Zheng WC, Cheng XY, Tao YH, Mao YS, Lu CP, Lin ZH, Chen J. 2024
Literature.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol C Toxicol Pharmacol. 2024 May 27;283:109943. doi: 10.1016/j.cbpc.2024.109943.PubMed
Literature.Title: Assessment of the antimicrobial and immunomodulatory activity of QS-CATH, a promising therapeutic agent isolated from the Chinese spiny frogs (Quasipaa spinosa).

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (60.53%) tofrog Lf-CATH1R=S: 13%, G=P: 11%. GRAVY: -0.28, mol wt: 4042.709, mol formula: C174H293N55O49S2, mol ex coeff: 125.Activity: active against P.mirabilis ATCC25933 (MIC>100 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC> 100 ug/ml), E. coli K12 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), S. enterica ATCC13076 (MIC 50 ug/ml), A.hydrophila ATCC7966 (MIC > 100 ug/ml), C.freundii ATCC43864 (MIC >100 ug/ml), S. flexneri ATCC12022 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml), S. warneri ATCC49454 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml),  V.harveyi ATCC33866 (MIC>100 ug/ml), V.anguillarum ATCC19264 (MIC > 100 ug/ml), V.alginolyticus ATCC17749 (MIC >100 ug/ml), and L. monocytogenes ATCC19115 (MIC 100 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria:S. flexneri: leak detected via the LDH assay.Proinflammatory:  12-h treatment of murine RAW264.7 cells increased TNF-alpha and IL-1beta.  Also showed chemotactic effect on RAW264.7 cells.Host expression:induced:  infection with A. hydrophila caused peptide expression, highest in spleen > lung > skin.
